newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil firms at close on supportive data talk.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil firms at close on supportive data talk.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICALS
Oct (3rd pos) 1,177 rgt/tonne Aug (south) 1,210 *
Open/Hi/Low 1,162/1,177/1,157 Prev close 1,207.50
Prev settlement 1,167 * sellers price

PALM OIL FUTURES - Talk of a friendly crop report by forecaster Ivan Wong aided prices to close higher. Trading was cautious initially with the market opening down on lower Chicago and stronger ringgit against the dollar. Oct futures contract support is 1,150 and resistance at 1,180.
PALM OIL PHYSICALS - Also saw prices rising in late trading after drifting uncertainly earlier.
Private forecaster Ivan Wong had earlier projected end-July stocks at 865,000-875,000 tonnes.
Cargo surveyor Caleb Brett put Malaysia's July bulk palm oil exports at 722,389 tonnes against its estimate of 634,753 tonnes for June.
Another cargo surveyor, SGS (M) Sdn Bhd estimated July exports at 710,836 tonnes against 611,368 for June.
Technically, there were some technical buying after third month October futures rose above the 1,170 ringgit.
October futures price closed 10 ringgit up at 1,177 ringgit ($450.96) a tonne.
The next resistance for October is 1,180 ringgit and support at 1,150, traders said.
Physicals Aug (south) was offered at 1,210 ringgit a tonne against bids of 1,205. It was traded from 1,200 to 1,205.
Aug (central) saw offers at 1,200 against bids of 1,195, with trades done at 1,185 and 1,195.
Sep (south) saw offers at 1,210 ringgit against bids of 1,205 with trades done at 1,200 and 1,205.
Sep (central) was offered at 1,200 against bids at 1,195.
In refined palm oil, Aug/Sep RBD palm oil was offered at $487.50 a tonne FOB Malaysia, and Oct/Nov/Dec at $485.
Aug RBD palm olein saw offers at $525, Sep at $522.50 and Oct/Nov/Dec at $520. Aug was traded at $520 and Sep at $517.50.
Aug RBD palm stearin was offered at $365, and Aug/Sep RBD palm fatty acid distillate saw offers at $290.
